wikipedia_page.main: Caroline  Russell (born 10 August 1962) is a Green Party of England and Wales politician and activist. Since May 2016, she has been a member of the London Assembly.

response: Caroline Russell, the leader of the Green Party on the London Assembly and Scott Ainslie, former Green MEP for London and councillor on Lambeth Council have both called for its closure.
* Health Committee, chaired by Caroline Russell
In 1989, Keating married Caroline Russell. Together they have three children; one son and two daughters.

The tunnel has been criticised by opponents who fear it will increase levels of traffic, in turn increasing air pollution. Green Party member and councillor Caroline Russell expressed concern that as the cost of the tunnel would be covered by tolling, future mayors of London will want to keep traffic levels high in order to pay this off. The lack of walking or cycling facilities in the tunnel has been criticised. A planned pedestrian and cyclist bridge from Rotherhithe to Canary Wharf, the Rotherhithe crossing, was cancelled in 2019.
*Cllr Caroline Russell, Green Party member on the London Assembly and Leader of the Opposition on Islington Council.

link_mentions.page: London Fire and Emergency Planning Authority

response: In June 2016,  Caroline Russell, a Green Party member of the London Assembly, asked new mayor of London Sadiq Khan to review the business case for a tram service via Waterloo Bridge and Elephant & Castle. London SE1 Community Website – 29 May 2008 Khan subsequently stated that he had no plans to revive the cancelled tram scheme, and expressed the view that improved Tube services and the extension of the London Overground through south London suburbs, along with the proposed re-opening of Camberwell railway station, would meet the transport needs along the corridor that would have been served by the Cross River Tram.

On 11 March 2017 the route was withdrawn between Loughton station and Debden station .Bus service proposal: Route 167 Transport for London Stagecoach London took over operation of the route on the same date from its Barking garage.Bus Service Changes 11 March to 16 April 2017 Transport for London 24 March 2017Barking Garage Stagecoach London Following a question from Caroline Russell, the Mayor of London stated that it would cost more than £500,000 per year to keep operating the 167 route to Debden, and the predicted fare income would only cover 40% of that cost. Later that year, colour-coded branding was introduced on the majority of vehicles running the route.
